alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Monroe (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:12PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A line of heavy showers will impact portions of Monroe and Lenawee Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 505 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of heavy showers along a line extending from near Onsted to near Milan to Flat Rock. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...A line of heavy showers will drift slowly southward early this evening producing torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rainfall rates around 1 inch per hour will be possible before the line passes south into Ohio later this evening. Heavy showers will be near... Onsted around 515 PM EDT. Dundee and Britton around 545 PM EDT. Petersburg and Clayton around 625 PM EDT. Monroe, Blissfield and Deerfield around 630 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these torrential rains include Newport, Manitou Beach-Devils Lake, Ogden Center, Canandaigua, Erie, Woodland Beach, Stony Point, Ridgeway, Palmyra and Bolles Harbor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
